awd_titl_txt: International Indian Statistical Association 2020 Conference: Statistics in the Era of Evidence-Based Inference
awd_abstract_narration:
IISA 2020: Statistics in the Era of Evidence Based Inference, a four-day international conference, will take place at University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), Illinois, from July 16 to July 19, 2020. The main objective of the conference is to bring together both well established and emerging young researchers, as well as students, who are actively pursuing theoretical and methodological research in statistics, biostatistics and data science and their applications in various scientific  fields. The format of the conference includes student paper competitions and presentations, short courses, plenary talks, special invited talks, invited sessions and contributed posters. The conference strives to maintain a healthy presence of women and minority in all these categories and of young researchers (within five years of their doctoral degrees) in invited sessions. For students, the conference will provide numerous opportunities including student paper competitions, speed sessions as well as short courses. The scientific program will span a wide range of topics ranging from the fundamentals of statistical theory to computationally-intensive methods and scientific application oriented data modeling, through a number of sessions classified as plenary, special invited, invited, student paper competition, posters, and panel discussions. In the tradition of IISA conferences, IISA 2020 will host a vibrant multi-stage student paper competition. The scientific program of IISA2020 will have plenary talks by three eminent speakers, special invited talks by eight leading researchers and about 50 invited sessions, each consisting of three presentations

The conference serves as the official annual meeting of the International Indian Statistical Association (IISA), IISA membership is open to all. IISA’s objectives are to promote education, research and application of statistics, probability and data science, to foster the exchange of information and scholarly activities, to serve the needs of young statisticians and data scientists and to encourage cooperative efforts among members in education, research, industry and business. IISA and University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC) are the primary organizers of the conference. UIC is part of the University of Illinois system and is the largest university in the Chicago area with a strong focus on diversity. IISA 2020 will bring together leaders, emerging researchers and students from diverse areas of statistics, biostatistics, probability and data science in a collaborative setting to discuss and foster the cutting-edge developments of statistical theory, methods and tools for making evidence based statistical inference from complex, noisy, tall and wide data sources. The conference will promote education, research and application of statistics, probability and data science and will foster the exchange of information and scholarly activities among scientific institutions in Chicago area, Midwest and in institutions across the United States.  The most up to date information and announcements regarding the conference is made available at the conference website https://www.intindstat.org/iisaconference2020/

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This NSF award was for the International Indian Statistical Association (IISA) 2020 conference which was postponed due to the pandemic. This award supported students and early career researchers for the IISA 2021 virtual conference and the IISA 2022 in-person conference. The IISA is a non-profit organization, with objectives to promote education, research and application of statistics, and data science,  to foster the exchange of information and scholarly activities, to serve the needs of young statisticians and data scientists, and to encourage cooperative efforts among its members. The IISA membership is open to everybody and IISA conferences are open to all including non-members of IISA.

The main objective of the IISA 2021 and 2022 conferences were to bring together  both well established and emerging young researchers, as well as students, from around the world who are actively pursuing theoretical and methodological research in statistics, biostatistics and data science and their applications in various scientific fields and  provide a forum  to discuss recent progress in statistical theory and applications and integration with data science in various complex data problems, thereby providing new directions for statistical inference in various fields to make proper evidence-based discoveries from complex data.

The scientific program of the IISA 2021 and IISA 2022 conferences spanned a wide range of topics ranging from the fundamentals of statistical theory to computationally intensive methods and scientific application-oriented data modeling, through a number of sessions classified as plenary, special invited, invited, contributed oral presentations, discussions, and student paper and poster competitions and presentations.

In the tradition of past IISA conferences, IISA 2021 and IISA 2022 hosted vibrant multi-stage student paper competitions. The student paper award committees consisted of a combination of early-career researchers and established leaders in the field. The first stage, pre-conference review selected students papers who were invited for oral presentations and a second-stage review. Student paper awards were given in two categories, theory and methodology of statistics and data sciences including probability theory, and applications of statistics and data sciences. The 2021 and 2022 student paper competitions were vibrant and received strong arrays of student paper submissions from a diverse range of students

The 2021 and 2022 conference programs included respectively three and four plenary presentations. These eminent speakers are role-models for the students and early career researchers and their cutting-age presentations fueled the growth of their research and learning. In addition, the 2021 and 2022 conferences each included eight special Invited talks, which were delivered by leading researchers. IISA 2021 hosted sixty-six invited sessions and IISA 2022 hosted eighty-two invited sessions. A significant percentage of the invited speakers in the IISA 2021 and IISA 2022 conferences were early and mid-career researchers, who benefitted from interactions with the plenary, special invited speakers, and the senior researchers.

IISA 2021 and IISA 2022 strived to have programs that reflected the diversity in the field of statistics. The plenary and special invited speakers were from leading nationwide research institutions and included women researchers. A number of Program Committee members and a number of invited speakers were women and/or early-career researchers.

The IISA 2021 and 2022 conferences promoted and fostered learning, research and application of statistical science, probability, and data science in general and especially among students, early career researchers and the next generation of thinkers and leaders in statistics and data sciences.
